definition: feudal fiefdom/land held as a vassal in feudal society/enfeoffment
surname Feng
to confer/to grant/to bestow a title/to seal/classifier for sealed objects, esp. letters
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
earth/ground/field/place/land/CL:片[pian4]
Kaifeng prefecture in Henan

sentences.english: Shangluo Municipality Perched on the southeast of Shaanxi, historically it was the fiefdom of Sang Yang, a reformer.
sentences.chinese: 商洛市位於陝西東南部，是歷史上商鞅的封地。

sentences.english: Rigo had confiscated Robin's ligeance so that he had to move away.
sentences.chinese: 他通過宣佈羅賓已經死亡來達到佔有其封地的目的。

sentences.english: The more fiefs Your Lords have the larger army they can have.
sentences.chinese: 更封地您上議院有較大的軍隊，他們可以擁有。

sentences.english: That is a fiefdom operated by one person and one of the most corrupt organizations working in India.
sentences.chinese: 那就是某人的封地，而它是印度最腐敗的組織之一了。

sentences.english: This had the effect however on turning areas such as Lijiang into small fiefdoms .
sentences.chinese: 在麗江這樣的邊遠小封地都是這樣。

sentences.english: And in the Yuan Dynasty, it was the fief of Genghis Khan's descendants.
sentences.chinese: 那麼元代的時候啊是成吉思汗子孫的封地。

sentences.english: In another word, the fiefs of the Zhou had no legal authority which the king had to follow.
sentences.chinese: 換句話說周的封地沒有讓國王必須跟從的法定權利。

sentences.english: But she loves his money and his lands.
sentences.chinese: 她愛的是他的錢和封地。

sentences.english: Fiefdoms need to fall and hierarchies need to give way to hyperlinks.
sentences.chinese: 封地會減少，等級制要爲超鏈接讓路。

sentences.english: Once again, Confucius was to be given land, but it did not happen.
sentences.chinese: 孔子再一次擁有得到封地的機會，但卻未能實現。

sentences.english: Where is the original feud of the Shang nationality whose ancestor established Shang Dynasty?
sentences.chinese: 曾經建立了商朝的商族，其始祖契的始封地究在何處？

sentences.english: Some localities have degenerated into private fiefdoms run by local party officials.
sentences.chinese: 一些地方已經淪爲地方黨政官員的私人封地。

sentences.english: YangGuang to yangzhou fief, farewell queen mother queen dugu.
sentences.chinese: 楊廣前往揚州封地，辭別母后獨孤皇后。

definition: grant of territory by an emperor or monarch (old)
vassal state
fief/benefice
order of feudal nobility, namely: Duke 公[gong1], Marquis 侯[hou2], Count 伯[bo2], Viscount 子[zi3], Baron 男[nan2]
to divide and confer (property on one's descendants)
to confer a title/to ennoble/to knight/title of nobility
to receive fief and title/to be enfeoffed/(fig.) to be rewarded by the emperor
succession/inheritance/hereditary
official ranking/titles and honors
canton/county/region
imperial clan/member of the imperial clan/clansman/ancestral shrine
an official position/a job in the bureaucracy
feudatory/vassal state
capital city
official in feudal court/subject

feudal vassal/feudal princes, esp. the monarchs (dukes or princes) of the several vassal states 諸侯國|诸侯国 of Zhou during Western Zhou and Spring and Autumn periods 11th-5th century BC/subordinate warlord/local official
